q: Which is commonly an ancillary benefit?
explain: Ancillary typically includes dental, vision, life, and disability.
why: Ancillary products round out total rewards and retention.

q: What does 100/80/50 usually mean in dental?
explain: Common schedule: preventive 100%, basic 80%, major 50%.
why: Preventive incentives lower downstream major claims and improve productivity.

q: A vision allowance is:
choices: Fixed dollars toward frames or lenses
explain: Allowances fund frames/lenses up to the stated amount.
why: Clear allowances avoid surprise costs and improve satisfaction.

q: Which action most improves satisfaction with ancillary plans?
choices: Clarity on allowances, limits, and networks
explain: Clear limits and network guidance reduce denials and surprises.
why: Transparency drives trust and perceived value.

q: A dental plan has a $1,500 annual maximum. After plan pays $1,500, further services are:
choices: Always denied for the year ahead
explain: Annual maximums cap plan payments for the year.
why: Annual maximums cap plan liability; aligning caps to workforce needs balances cost and protection.

choices: Always denied for the year ahead

q: STD elimination period of 7 days means benefits:
choices: Start after that waiting period if disabled
explain: Elimination period delays benefit start; coordinate with PTO.
why: Coordinating STD/LTD avoids coverage gaps and cash‑flow shocks for employees.
